channel.title: DIY on Something We Ate
channel.description: Recent content in DIY on Something We Ate

item.title: Taco Seasoning
item.description: So one of my white whales (I have many) is taco seasoning. Growing up in northern MN, “tacos” always meant ground beef + packet of taco seasoning. Sure you can mix in veggies, hard/soft shells, lettuce for taco salad, blah blah blah. That’s what tacos always were to me. Then I found Nacho’s. Before I go any further, let me say that their logo does not represent the food, atmosphere, or people at Nacho’s.

item.title: Peach Jam
item.description: So I’ve had a lot of fun discovering Jam (and by extension, preserving). It was largely inspired by a video series on tastemade. Kevin West taught the class on jam based entirely on his book Saving The Season. It’s a fantastic video series and the book is great. It’s particularly nice that he goes into explaining jam. I like to understand what I’m doing and really hate recipe books that just give you recipes without teaching you to understand what you’re doing.
